page.title: 07LANGENHOE HALL FARM
page.content:
We went to{Langenhoe Hall Farm.}The farmer grows wheat on his farm . He starts planting in September with a seeder. He uses his TW25 to spray and seed and plough.When the wheat is ripe in August the combine harvester cuts it down.
The farm covers 900 acres, most of the fields being large, upto 100 acres in size. From a harvest of about 2500 tons, some of the wheat is sent to {Ipswich}and some to{London}and some is exported from the Hythe Quay in Colchester.
Some of the land near the river is unsuitable for growing wheat and this land is used for grazing cattle.
